name: WebShortcutUtil
body:
### Overview
This is a suite of libraries and tools for working with web shortcuts.
Web shortcuts are the files that are created by various operating systems when you save
a link to a website.

I have found myself using various operating systems over the years, and I also
have been increasingly using cloud file services.  I sometimes work in one
operating system, create a shortcut, put the shortcut on a cloud service, then try
to open the shortcut in another operating system.  This generally does not work.
There are workarounds such as opening the shortcuts with a text editor and copying the
URL, or using link services such as Delicious.

I decided to try and create a set of applications and libraries that would allow you to
open any shortcut regardless of which operating system you are using.  A major goal was
to gain experience using various programming languages, installers, etc., and this project
seemed ideal, since the libraries/applications would be fairly small.
I originally intended to create installable applications for Windows, Linux, and maybe Apple, 
but never did.  There is a lot of room for improvement, but I no longer will have the time.

The functionality is as follows:
- Be able to retrieve the name and URL of Windows, Linux, and Apple
  shortcuts.  Specifically these are files with the following extensions:
  .url, .website, .desktop, .webloc.
- Be able to create shortcut files given a name and URL.
- More details can be found in the library documentation.

Below you will find a list of the applications/libraries.

### Launcher for PCs
This is a command line Java application that allows you to launch shortcuts on your PC.
Unfortunately, due to differences in operating systems, it is difficult
to open a browser reliably in Java.  Therefore, this application will not
work on all operating systems or distributions.

This Java application could be packaged into installers for the various
operating systems, but I have no plans to do so.
Instead, I have a wiki page with manual installation instructions, which
are unfortunately cumbersome and incomplete.

- Installation wiki page: https://github.com/abcodeworks/LaunchWebShortcut-Java/wiki/Installing/
- Source code: https://github.com/abcodeworks/LaunchWebShortcut-Java/

### Android App
This is an Android app that allows you to launch and create shortcuts.

- Android Marketplace Page: 
- Source code: https://github.com/abcodeworks/WebShortcut-Android/

### Java Library
This library has been tested on Android and
appears to be completely compatible. The functionality and implementation
is largely equivalent to the Java library.

- Source code: https://github.com/abcodeworks/WebShortcutUtil-Java/
- Maven Repository: 
- Javadocs:  http://abcodeworks.github.io/WebShortcutUtil-Java/javadoc/latest/

### Perl Library
This is a PERL library.  The functionality and implementation
is largely equivalent to the Java library.

- Source code: https://github.com/beckus/WebShortcutUtil-Perl/
- CPAN module: http://search.cpan.org/~beckus/WebShortcutUtil/

### Samples
During development I collected a set of shortcuts from
various operating systems (both to study and to use for
unit tests).  I made these available in their own repository.

- Repository: https://github.com/beckus/WebShortcutSamples/

### Author
Andre Beckus (@beckus)
